skill.name: backend-pr-workflow
skill.description: Pedantic Diversio backend dev workflow Skill that enforces ClickUp-linked branch/PR naming, PR hygiene, safe Django migrations, and downtime-safe schema changes for Django4Lyfe-style backends.
skill.summary: Pedantic Diversio backend dev workflow Skill that enforces ClickUp-linked branch/PR naming, PR hygie...
skill.author: DiversioTeam

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and AI behavior guidelines. No executable code, no network calls, no file system modifications, and no external command execution. The skill consists solely of markdown instructions for reviewing pull requests.

content.value_statement: Backend PRs often miss critical issues like unsafe migrations or missing ticket links. This skill enforces ClickUp-linked naming conventions, reviews PR hygiene, and validates that schema changes are safe for production.
actual_capabilities: Reviews Django migrations for safety and cleanliness
Ensures schema changes avoid production downtime
Validates release and hotfix branch workflows
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Does not modify files or create branches
Does not access external APIs or services
Requires user to provide PR details manually

use_cases.title: Review Django PRs
use_cases.description: Validate that your Django PR follows naming, migration, and deployment safety standards before requesting review.

use_cases.title: Validate release workflows
use_cases.description: Ensure release PRs and hotfixes follow correct branch patterns and include required version bumps.

use_cases.title: Enforce team conventions
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent PR hygiene across the team by requiring ClickUp linkage and migration safety checks.

prompt_templates.title: Quick PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the backend-pr-workflow skill to check my PR. Here is the branch name, PR title, and base branch:

prompt_templates.title: Migration safety check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use backend-pr-workflow to verify my migrations and rollout plan are downtime-safe. I added a nullable field with a backfill migration.

prompt_templates.title: Pre-submit validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Before I open this backend PR, run backend-pr-workflow on my planned title, description, and migration summary.

prompt_templates.title: Hotfix validation
prompt_templates.prompt: For this hotfix PR on our Django backend, use backend-pr-workflow to check that my base branch, title, and release plan are correct.

output_examples.input: Review my PR with branch clickup_GH-785_my-feature, title 'Added new user field', base branch release, and a migration adding is_active boolean.
output: ‚ö†Ô∏è [SHOULD_FIX] Adding non-nullable boolean default on large table may cause table rewrite - use two-step migration pattern
‚úÖ Migration adds nullable field without default - safe approach

best_practices: Always include the full ClickUp ticket ID in branch names and PR titles
Use nullable columns with no default for large tables, then backfill separately
Split field removals into code-first and schema-second PRs to avoid downtime
anti_patterns: Using short numeric ticket IDs instead of custom ClickUp IDs like GH-785
Adding multiple iterative migrations for the same feature in one PR
Mixing code and schema removal in the same PR for field deletions

faq.question: Does this skill work with non-Django projects?
faq.answer: This skill is optimized for Django backends. It may still provide value for general PR hygiene checks on other Python backends.

faq.question: What ticket ID formats are supported?
faq.answer: Custom ClickUp IDs like GH-785 or WEB-123. The numeric internal ID is not supported - use the custom format.

faq.question: Can I use this for frontend PRs?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on backend concerns like migrations. Frontend PRs can still use naming checks but migration advice will not apply.

faq.question: Is my PR data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that runs within your AI session. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: What if my repo has different conventions?
faq.answer: Local AGENTS.md or CLAUDE.md files take precedence. This skill provides a baseline, not a replacement for team-specific rules.

faq.question: How is this different from pre-commit hooks?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered review with context awareness. Pre-commit hooks enforce rules automatically. Use both for maximum coverage.
